30M         4K:15:256   560639999  5017 3858 3743   0.296567/0.411513  0.299681/0.420722  0.296271/0.409348
32M         4K:8:512    599619997  -    -    -              -                  -                  -
32M         4K:4:1K     599619997  6275 4077 4051   0.337565/0.480981  0.343249/0.449391  0.338750/0.446109

For the default TRIG_COMPUTE = 2: two of the variants did not even finish because the GEC at the 800 iteration check hit a repeatable error and failed due to a fatal ROE. There were also a few variants where the GEC failed at the final 10K iteration check, including those obviously fatal 0.53 and 0.52 max ROEs. I believe Mlucas during its self-test mode considers any ROEs above 0.4375 to be fatal, so using that criteria would mean an additional 24 variants had a fatal ROE. For the second issue, in this output the variant listed first for each FFT length is the one that would be selected by default. As you can see, for 8 FFT lengths, the fastest variant is not the one selected by default.

For TRIG_COMPUTE = 0, 24 variants had a fatal ROE.
For TRIG_COMPUTE = 1, 28 variants had a fatal ROE.
For TRIG_COMPUTE = 2, 26 variants had a fatal ROE.

Overall, the default TRIG_COMPUTE = 2 had the best performance, which was slightly (2%) better than TRIG_COMPUTE=1, but significantly (17.8%) better than TRIG_COMPUTE=0. Here is the graph (this is using a logarithmic scale):

[see original e-mail]
